- Covers abusive behaviors, including physical harm, emotional abuse, sexual abuse and financial abuse.

- Provides mechanisms for emergency protection orders and restraining measures.

- Establishes shelters and counseling for victims.

- Prohibits gender discrimination in hiring, promotions and employment practices.

- Guarantees maternity leave for female employees (98 days with pay).

- Provides paternity leave for fathers in private sectors (minimum of 7 days from January 2023).

- Ensures equal pay for equal work regardless of gender.

- Requires organizations to establish internal mechanisms to handle complaints of sexual harassment.

- Empowers the Tribunal for Anti-Sexual Harassment to address grievances.

- Imposes penalties for failure to prevent or address harassment.

- Defines rape and sexual assault with corresponding punishments.

- Criminalizes statutory rape (sexual relations with individuals below the age of consent).

- Provides aggravated punishments for rape involving harm or threats.

- Requires the minimum marriage age to be 18 years (with exceptions for minors with court approval).

- Ensures financial support (maintenance) for women after divorce.

- Addresses issues of custody and alimony for children and spouses.
- Establishes minimum age for marriage (16 for females) with exceptions through Sharia court approval.\n\n- Provides rights for divorce, maintenance and child custody.

- Spouses (including former spouses).

- Children.

- Family members living in the same household.

- Individuals in de facto relationships or engagements.

- All employees under the private sector.

- Pregnant women and new mothers.

- Fathers in formal employment.

- Employees in workplaces.

- Students in educational institutions.

- Members of the public in shared spaces.
- Women and girls who are victims of rape or sexual assault.\n\n- Minors below the age of consent.
- Non-Muslim women and men in marital relationships.\n\n- Children involved in custody disputes.
- Muslim women and girls in Malaysia.
